definitions: temporary problem or obstacle that causes a delay or difficulty
type of knot used to fasten a rope to another object
sudden upward jerking movement of something being pulled
examples: The project ran without a hitch until the final week
We encountered a small hitch with the delivery schedule
She tied a clove hitch around the fence post
The sailor demonstrated various hitches for securing the boat
He felt a painful hitch in his shoulder when lifting
The trailer moved forward with a slight hitch

definitions: person who travels by getting free rides in passing vehicles
examples: The hitchhiker stood by the roadside with his thumb out
We picked up a friendly hitchhiker heading to Denver
Many hitchhikers carry signs showing their destination
The movie featured a mysterious hitchhiker with a dark secret

definitions: person who is paid to kill someone especially as part of organized crime
examples: The movie's plot centered around a retired hitman seeking redemption
Police uncovered evidence linking the suspect to hitman activities
The crime novel featured a hitman with a moral code
Witnesses testified about hiring a hitman to solve their problem

definitions: baseball player known for their batting ability and success
person or thing that strikes or hits something forcefully
examples: She's the team's best hitter with a batting average over three hundred
The coach recruited several power hitters for next season
The boxer was known as a hard hitter in the ring
That storm was a real hitter causing widespread damage

definitions: action of striking something or someone with force
examples: The hitting of the ball requires perfect timing and technique
Coaches emphasized hitting practice during spring training
The constant hitting of waves against the shore eroded the cliff
There's no hitting allowed in this classroom

definitions: structure where bees live and produce honey consisting of wax cells
place full of activity and busy people working together
examples: The beekeeper carefully inspected each hive for signs of disease
A swarm of bees established a new hive in the oak tree
The office was a hive of activity before the deadline
The marketplace became a hive of commerce every Saturday morning

definitions: large collection of valuable things that someone keeps hidden or stored
examples: Archaeologists discovered an ancient hoard of gold coins buried underground
The dragon guarded its hoard of treasure in the mountain cave
She kept a secret hoard of chocolate in her desk drawer
The squirrel's hoard of acorns lasted through the winter

definitions: behavior of collecting and keeping large amounts of things often unnecessarily
large board used for displaying advertisements in public places
examples: His hoarding of old newspapers filled every room in the house
The TV show helps people overcome compulsive hoarding behaviors
The new product was advertised on a massive hoarding downtown
Construction hoarding surrounded the building site for safety

definitions: trick or deception intended to make people believe something false
examples: The viral video turned out to be an elaborate hoax
Police warned residents about an email hoax targeting seniors
The museum's mermaid skeleton was exposed as a nineteenth century hoax
He admitted the UFO sighting was just a hoax

definitions: flat cooking surface on top of a stove with burners or heating elements
examples: She placed the kettle on the hob to boil water
The ceramic hob was easier to clean than gas burners
All four rings on the hob were being used for dinner
He accidentally left the hob on after cooking breakfast

definitions: small humanlike creature with hairy feet from Tolkien's fantasy novels
examples: Bilbo Baggins is the most famous hobbit in literature
The hobbit lived in a cozy hole in the ground
Hobbits are known for their love of food and comfort
The movie brought the hobbit characters to life beautifully

definitions: activity done regularly in spare time for pleasure and relaxation
examples: Photography has been her favorite hobby for twenty years
He turned his weekend hobby into a successful business
Collecting stamps is a popular hobby among all age groups
She has expensive hobbies like sailing and skiing

definitions: person who pursues a particular hobby with dedication and interest
examples: The model train hobbyist spent thousands on his collection
Local hobbyists meet monthly to share their projects
She's a serious photography hobbyist with professional grade equipment
The woodworking hobbyist crafted beautiful furniture in his garage

definitions: small ugly creature from folklore that causes trouble or mischief
examples: The children dressed as hobgoblins for the Halloween party
Old tales warned of hobgoblins playing tricks on travelers
Shakespeare's Puck was a type of hobgoblin character
The hobgoblin in the story stole shiny objects from houses

definitions: person who travels from place to place without a home often seeking work
examples: During the Depression many hobos rode freight trains seeking employment
The old hobo shared stories of his travels across America
He lived like a hobo for years before settling down
The museum exhibit featured photographs of hobos from the 1930s

definitions: joint in the hind leg of a horse or similar animal
state of being held as security for a loan in a pawnshop
examples: The veterinarian examined the horse's injured hock carefully
The dog's hock showed signs of arthritis with age
He had to put his guitar in hock to pay rent
Most of her jewelry was in hock at the pawnshop

definitions: long handled gardening tool with a flat blade for breaking soil and removing weeds
examples: She used a hoe to prepare the garden beds for planting
The farmer sharpened his hoe before starting the day's work
He bought a new hoe with an ergonomic handle design
The old hoe had been in the family for generations

definitions: large domestic pig especially one raised for meat production
person who takes more than their fair share of something
examples: The farmer raised hogs for the local meat market
A huge hog won first prize at the county fair
Don't be such a hog with the popcorn at movie night
He's a road hog who never lets anyone pass

definitions: machine or device used for lifting and moving heavy objects vertically
examples: The construction crew used a hoist to lift materials to upper floors
The boat hoist made launching vessels much easier
Workers operated the hoist to move cargo from the ship
The garage installed a new engine hoist for repairs

definitions: device or object designed to hold something in place
person who owns or possesses something officially or legally
examples: The cup holder in her car could fit different sized drinks
He bought a new phone holder for his bicycle
The ticket holder must present ID at the entrance
Account holders received notice of the policy changes

definitions: something owned or possessed especially property or financial assets
company owned by a holding company as part of its investments
examples: Their largest holding was a portfolio of rental properties
The family's holdings included stocks bonds and real estate
The corporation added another holding to its media empire
Each holding operates independently under the parent company

definitions: person who refuses to agree or comply when others have accepted
examples: She was the last holdout in the jury deliberation room
The star player remained a holdout during contract negotiations
Only one holdout prevented unanimous approval of the proposal
Several holdouts refused to sell their land to developers

definitions: person or thing that remains from a previous time or administration
examples: He was a holdover from the previous management team
The policy was a holdover from the company's early days
Several holdovers from last year's squad made the team
That tradition is a holdover from colonial times

definitions: loud cry or shout especially to attract attention or express emotion
examples: Give me a holler when you're ready to leave
We heard a holler from the back of the crowd
The coach's holler could be heard across the entire field
She let out a holler of joy when she won

definitions: empty space or cavity inside something solid
small valley or depression in the land between hills
examples: The tree trunk had a large hollow where animals nested
She discovered a hollow beneath the floorboards
They built their cabin in a peaceful hollow surrounded by mountains
The creek ran through the hollow behind their property

definitions: evergreen shrub or tree with shiny leaves and red berries used in Christmas decorations
examples: They decorated the mantle with holly branches for the holidays
The holly bush in their yard attracted many birds
Wild holly grows throughout the forest providing winter color
She wore a sprig of holly in her hair

definitions: tall garden plant with large colorful flowers growing on upright spikes
examples: Pink hollyhocks lined the cottage garden path beautifully
She planted hollyhocks against the fence for summer color
The hollyhocks grew over six feet tall this year
Grandmother's garden always featured old fashioned hollyhocks

definitions: destruction or slaughter on a mass scale especially by fire
systematic murder of six million Jews by Nazi Germany during World War Two
examples: The nuclear holocaust in the movie destroyed civilization
Environmental activists warned of an ecological holocaust
Holocaust survivors shared their stories with students
The Holocaust museum preserves evidence of the genocide

definitions: three dimensional image created by laser light that appears to float in space
examples: The credit card featured a hologram for security purposes
Scientists created a hologram of the human brain
The concert used holograms to bring deceased performers back
She studied the hologram from different angles

definitions: technique of producing three dimensional images using interference patterns of laser light
examples: Holography has applications in data storage and security features
He studied holography at the institute of technology
Medical holography helps doctors visualize complex anatomical structures
The museum's holography exhibit fascinated visitors of all ages

definitions: leather or fabric case for carrying a handgun attached to a belt or strap
examples: The detective adjusted the holster on his hip
She chose a concealed holster for her service weapon
The cowboy's holster was decorated with silver studs
He practiced drawing quickly from his holster

definitions: special honor or respect shown publicly to someone or something
examples: The film was an homage to classic noir detective stories
They paid homage to the founding members at the ceremony
The artist's work was an homage to her cultural heritage
Fans gathered to pay homage to the legendary musician

definitions: informal term for a man especially in Spanish speaking contexts
examples: That hombre knows how to handle horses really well
The tough hombre walked into the saloon confidently
He's one tough hombre who never backs down
The old hombre shared stories of the border towns

definitions: beer or other alcoholic beverage made at home rather than commercially
examples: His homebrew won first place at the local competition
They started a homebrew club to share recipes
The basement was set up for making homebrew batches
She experimented with different hops in her homebrew

definitions: return to one's home after time away often marked by celebration
examples: The soldier's homecoming brought tears of joy to everyone
High school homecoming includes a dance and football game
Her homecoming after years abroad was bittersweet
The university planned a huge homecoming weekend for alumni

definitions: person who manages a home and family as their primary occupation
examples: She chose to be a homemaker after her children were born
The homemaker balanced budgeting cooking and childcare expertly
Modern homemakers often run home based businesses too
He became a homemaker while his partner pursued her career

definitions: system of alternative medicine using highly diluted substances to treat illness
examples: She studied homeopathy as a complement to conventional medicine
The homeopathy clinic offered natural remedies for common ailments
Critics argue that homeopathy lacks scientific evidence
Many people swear by homeopathy for treating allergies

definitions: person who owns the house or apartment where they live
examples: The homeowner installed solar panels to reduce energy costs
New homeowners often underestimate maintenance expenses
The homeowners association met monthly to discuss community issues
First time homeowners qualified for special loan programs

definitions: main or first page of a website that provides access to other pages
examples: The company redesigned their homepage for better user experience
Visitors can find all important links on our homepage
She set the news site as her browser's homepage
The homepage featured their latest products and promotions

definitions: baseball hit that allows the batter to circle all bases and score
examples: He hit his first homer of the season last night
The crowd erupted when she hit a grand slam homer
That homer put them ahead in the ninth inning
He's just two homers away from the team record

definitions: classroom where students meet at the beginning of each school day
examples: Students report to homeroom for attendance and announcements
Her homeroom teacher helped with college applications
The homeroom period lasted fifteen minutes each morning
They decorated their homeroom for the holiday competition

definitions: house and land occupied by a family especially a farm with its buildings
examples: Their ancestors established the homestead in eighteen sixty
The old homestead had been in the family for generations
They bought land to create a self sufficient homestead
The historic homestead is now a museum

definitions: city or town where a person was born or grew up
examples: She returned to her hometown after college graduation
The celebrity donated millions to his hometown library
Nothing beats the familiar streets of your hometown
They organized a hometown reunion for their graduating class

definitions: crime of killing another person either intentionally or through criminal negligence
examples: The detective worked in the homicide division for twenty years
Police ruled the death a homicide after investigation
Homicide rates decreased significantly in the past decade
The prosecutor charged him with first degree homicide

definitions: sermon or religious discourse delivered as part of a church service
examples: The priest delivered a moving homily about forgiveness
Her homily focused on the importance of community service
The bishop's homily lasted exactly fifteen minutes
He prepared his Sunday homily with careful thought
